content.description: An area classic. Fairly steep all the way to the top, but short enough not to have to worry about pumping out. Fun pockets all the way up. With large holds every few feet.
content.protection: 5 bolts to Mussy Hooks. The first bolt is fairly high, so treat it as a boulder problem with good holds for the clip and positive feet.
content.location: 4th large formation on your left as you walk up the draw. Very obvious scoop in the rock filled with pockets.

content.description:
This is essentially a variation to Ruffles, sharing the start and finish for that route, but with a slightly harder crux.

Clip the first bolt of Ruffles and move left on decent, but not great holds before continuing up on big jugs characteristic of Ruffles. A bit of a crux is encountered before rejoining with Ruffles at the top, moving right to the same anchor.
content.location: Just left of Ruffles, sharing the same start and finish.
